pull.title: Use the new name Bitcoin Core Daemon instead of Bitcoin server
pull.body: The name of the daemon was changed from Bitcoin server to Bitcoin Core Daemon. This change fixes the --help usage text accordingly.

events.message: Use the new name Bitcoin Core Daemon instead of Bitcoin server

events.body: Does bitcoin-cli need a similar update?

events.message: Use the new name Bitcoin Core instead of Bitcoin for RPC client
The botcoin-cli name is Bitcoin Core RPC client.

events.body: ACK after squashing to one commit.

events.message: Use the new name Bitcoin Core in the usage string.

events.body:
Done both.
The web UI doesn't allow me to squash commits into one and I do not see how to clone the patch-2 to my local machine, sorry.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/c63dc4664daf80ea6e3bf4c2baf409ef14329529 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
Committed via db3a5e4 (I did the squashing for you this time)

comments.body: Ehh don't remove the 'RPC client' part here

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -82,9 +82,9 @@ bool AppInit(int argc, char* argv[])
             // First part of help message is specific to bitcoind / RPC client
             std::string strUsage = _("Bitcoin Core Daemon") + " " + _("version") + " " + FormatFullVersion() + "\n\n" +
                 _("Usage:") + "\n" +
-                  "  bitcoind [options]                     " + _("Start Bitcoin server") + "\n" +
+                  "  bitcoind [options]                     " + _("Start Bitcoin Core Daemon") + "\n" +
                 _("Usage (deprecated, use bitcoin-cli):") + "\n" +
-                  "  bitcoind [options] <command> [params]  " + _("Send command to Bitcoin server") + "\n" +
+                  "  bitcoind [options] <command> [params]  " + _("Send command to Bitcoin Core Daemon") + "\n" +
comments.body: Just make this "Send command to Bitcoin Core" without the Daemon as it's also possible to send commands to an GUI in -server mode.
